comments.value:
Thanks Huw, We did look at that page (a long time ago) and followed up on the best practice stuff like correct SPF records, making sure our link text matched the url it was linking to. As far as I can tell Microsoft's Sender ID Framework program is just another term for SPF records http://www.microsoft.com/mscorp/safety/content/technologies/senderid/wizard/default.aspx One last option we haven't yet tried is to pay for a 3rd party white listing service like ReturnPath (previously called to be Sender Score Certified) http://www.returnpath.net/commercialsender/certification/ http://www.senderscorecertified.com/about/fees.php I did have a vague feeling Morag looked into this (Morag do you remember anything about it?). Happy to spend some time investigating the above further, unless you think there is someone better placed at LOCOG to do this on a company wide basis? I expect you also want this to cover email sent on your behalf by a whole bunch of providers. The pricing for ReturnPath isn't inconsequential and is based on volume so you may prefer to negotiate / handle costs here directly if this is a route you think it is sensible for us to go down. Jamie btw. #Morag#, this is more one for Demy's I just generated a new SPF record (sorry for the geekyness - SPF is the entry in 2012's DNS records that says 'it's fine for Kitsite's servers to send email on our behalf') anyway I just generated a new record which included a include:kitsite.com bit. Maybe you could just forward them this question, thanks: We have just re-generated an SPF record for the london2102.con domain to include the server/IP address 89.187.66.118 (milo.kitsite.com) [which is already in the current record] however we noticed that the domain kitsite.com was listed explicitly 'include:kitsite.com' in this version and wondered if that would have any impact on the success / failure of emails delivered from 89.187.66.118 (milo.kitsite.com) on london2012.com's behalf. What we have: "v=spf1 ip4:213.48.118.37 ip4:213.121.128.0/26 ip4:89.234.20.132/28 ip4:213.215.157.240 ip4:213.121.129.192/26 ip4:89.187.66.118 ip4:62.140.221.10 ip4:202.60.76.30 ip4:194.116.199.82 ip4:213.86.53.6 mx ~all" What the MS SPF wizard recommends, notice the inclusion of include:kitsite.com I'm not totally sure we need it but it may help, although I'm sure Demy's are far more knowledgeable about this that me. v=spf1 mx ip4:213.48.118.37 ip4:213.121.128.0/26 ip4:89.234.20.132/28 ip4:213.215.157.240 ip4:213.121.129.192/26 ip4:89.187.66.118 ip4:62.140.221.10 ip4:202.60.76.30 ip4:194.116.199.82 ip4:213.86.53.6 include:kitsite.com ~all On 14 Dec 2009, at 11:43, Huw Williams wrote: Dear Both You might already have gone down this route but here is a response to the email problem Thanks From: Andy Smith [mailto:andsmith@microsoft.com] Sent: 08 December 2009 08:04 To: Huw Williams Subject: RE: Email problem - can you help? Hi Huw, Have got a response from the Hotmail team. They have advised that the best way to investigate the problem is to raise a support incident at: http://postmaster.live.com/ Are you able to access this site and raise the issue? Regards Andy From: Huw Williams [mailto:Huw.Williams@london2012.com] Sent: 04 December 2009 10:38 To: Andy Smith Subject: Email problem - can you help? Andy I have a slightly offbeat question that you might (or might not) be able to answer. If you can't, not a problem, but I thought I'd ask anyway. We seem to be having some problems sending bulk emails from our mailing list to Hotmail domains and we wondered if there was anything we could do about this problem and if you could help. Like I said, you might not be able to help but thanks for trying -----Original Message----- From: Morag Reavley Sent: 03 December 2009 17:54 To: Jamie Unwin; Huw Williams Subject: RE: Microsoft white labelling Great - thanks, Jamie! -----Original Message----- From: Jamie Unwin [mailto:jamie@kitsite.com] Sent: 03 December 2009 17:32 To: Huw Williams Cc: Morag Reavley Subject: Re: Microsoft white labelling Hi Huw The raw headers / body of the signup email is below. They get sent with a From and Reply to address of registration@london2012.com The actual server sending them is milo.kitsite.com (89.187.66.118) which has a SPF record in the london2012.com DNS jamie-674:~ jamie$ dig +short TXT london2012.com "v=spf1 ip4:213.48.118.37 ip4:213.121.128.0/26 ip4:89.234.20.132/28 ip4:213.215.157.240 ip4:213.121.129.192/26 ip4:89.187.66.118 ip4:62.140.221.10 ip4:202.60.76.30 ip4:194.116.199.82 ip4:213.86.53.6 mx ~all" The issues seems to be that a higher than average (average being compared to gmail / yahoo) number of Hotmail users not confirming their email address. Which seems to suggest Hotmail users on a whole don't like confirming their email address or that Hotmail is spam filtering them. In our tests (done a while back) the later seemed true, namely that they we're ending up in the junk folder. Although some are obviously getting though as we do have Hotmail users. Hope that's enough info to get started. Jamie On 3 Dec 2009, at 16:51, Morag Reavley wrote: > Hi there, > > Huw has asked: is it possible to send us the exact problem you are > having with email and hotmail domains so he can ask his Microsoft > contact to get you whitelisted? I think we need the 'send' email > address/es you are using. > > Thank you! > > Morag > Return-Path: Delivered-To: jamie@1210407.1956873 Received: (qmail 28979 invoked by uid 78); 3 Dec 2009 17:17:27 -0000 Received: from unknown (HELO cloudmark1) (10.49.16.97) by 0 with SMTP; 3 Dec 2009 17:17:27 -0000 Return-Path: Received: from [89.187.66.118] ([89.187.66.118:60556] helo=milo.kitsite.com) by cm-mr22 (envelope-from ) (ecelerity 2.2.2.41 r(31179/31189)) with ESMTP id 56/A6-02764-6A2F71B4; Thu, 03 Dec 2009 12:17:27 -0500 Received: from milo.kitsite.com (milo.kitsite.com [127.0.0.1]) by milo.kitsite.com (8.14.1/8.14.1) with ESMTP id nB3HHPOY013204 for ; Thu, 3 Dec 2009 17:17:26 GMT Date: Thu, 3 Dec 2009 17:17:25 GMT From: London 2012 To: jamie@jamie.net Message-ID: <1611508769.1601259860645368.JavaMail.kitsite@milo.kitsite.com > Subject: Your London 2012 registration MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8 Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable Hello from London 2012

comments.value:
To convert latest News/Blogs components to related we'll need to update the latest :

- create a related blog, news function
- test it works
- update the templates where this is currently used:

Generic hub
Video
Virtual tour
Venue
Photo page
Generic content
Sport

* do all these templates/pages need to show related news/blogs or do some just want to still show just the latest?

- test site to check this hasn't broken anything
- republish all pages using those templates (we may have mix of both versions while this happens.

Related content will only be related at time of publication.

Latest news / Latest blogs should appear on the associated hub and the home page.

Suppress header if no related news/blogs and check a missing column (news or blogs) won't throw the layout out.
 
Unless otherwise stated the news will be related by relevancy *not* date.

I think it makes sense to factor time in some. Could we try a weighting
system? So tag matching is weighted like 70% and time 30%.

 

We'll also probably need to change 'latest news' to 'related news'.

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com <http://www.london2012.com> 

www.twitter.com/london2012team

________________________________

From: Jamie Unwin [mailto:notifications-support@postcms.zendesk.com] 
Sent: 10 December 2009 16:27
To: Liz Goulding
Subject: [PostCMS support] Re: Convert latest News/Blogs components to
related (on the following templates)
Importance: High

Hi Liz,

The news and blog widgets should now be showing related content (will need to republish the site for changes to take effect on live server)
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/games/games-heritage/index.php

- Content is now pulled in based on number of matching tags
- The last 30 days (at the point at which the page is published) is given a boost

Once your happy we can bulk publish the relevant pages.

thanks

Jamie

ps. the weighting formula is scary/complex ( http://lucene.apache.org/java/2_1_0/api/org/apache/lucene/search/Similarity.html ) and so questions along the lines of  'why is page X appearing befre page Y may result in me jokingly sending you that link ;-) the short answer is it's based on that formula and it can be very time consuming to figure it out for any two pages. If pages are really not appearing that should then we can investigate, but just letting you know upfront it can be very time consuming, so lets save for pages that you *really* think should be appearing in a particular order that aren't.

Well, that page looks brilliant. I'll go check out a few more sections,
and let you know, but it's looking great!

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Does that look like a tag from Getty? we had this issue before where by they sent the tags as one long string rather than:

1) split by a comma
2) sent as separate fields

We can't just split on spaces as some tags have spaces.

This is what Getty need to send.
<gyi:value name="GYI_KEYWORDS">Stories of the World, Billy Bragg, major project, culture, MLA</gyi:value>

We also coded it to deal with multiple <GYI_KEYWORDS>fields with one phrase each, so if that is easier for them.

Until Getty fix the issue this will continue to happy (we can limit a single tag to X chars but expect this isn't what you want?)

If you send an image you can check the tags at http://gettyftp.kitsite.com/images.php

Jamie

So I think we've discovered at least one of the problems. The field
GYI_Keywords is the GETTY keywords, *not* the CMS keywords. Fort his
file, Amy sent through 2 CMS keywords, 'dressage', and 'eventing' and
there don't seem to be anything named appropriately. See below.

 

ALSO I went into the CMS to check the image from when it was sent much
earlier today. And that one is definitely missing the *meta* tags in
the CMS (like equestrian for both sport and paralympic sport, and the
venue information for Greenwich park) and those certainly are in the
xml.

I think the problem is the content isn't clear enough from the design, looking at it again the page title / browser titles *shouldn't'* change, but the title under the image should (as per CogApps original design, although we have now changed the way this work, which I;m not sure was a good move *). If it was more obvious that what you we're doing was flicking though photos 'in page' then the problem would go away.

Hi Jamie, We've just been looking into the photo gallery page, specifically the image sliders, with javascript turned off and noticed that on pages such as this one: http://www.london2012.com/photos/2009/08/aquatics-centre-roof-64877.php the bottom image slider does not function properly when javascript is turned off. It seems that are are two inline styles which must have been copied in from the static html templates Martin and I sent to you :
which means that the right hand arrow slider control is always being shown, when it should disappear if javascript is turned off. Removing the 'style="display:block" will remedy this problem. The other problem is there is no horizontal scrollbar on the image slider due to the following code:
Removing the style="overflow: hidden;" on this div will mean the horizontal scroll bar appears when javascript is turned off. I didn't notice this happening on other pages such as http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/ which works as expected so I'm not sure if this is happening else where or not. Thanks,

subject: Photo pages /  no javascript / cogapp amends
description:
Hi Jamie, We've just been looking into the photo gallery page, specifically the image sliders, with javascript turned off and noticed that on pages such as this one: http://www.london2012.com/photos/2009/08/aquatics-centre-roof-64877.php the bottom image slider does not function properly when javascript is turned off. It seems that are are two inline styles which must have been copied in from the static html templates Martin and I sent to you :
which means that the right hand arrow slider control is always being shown, when it should disappear if javascript is turned off. Removing the 'style="display:block" will remedy this problem. The other problem is there is no horizontal scrollbar on the image slider due to the following code:
Removing the style="overflow: hidden;" on this div will mean the horizontal scroll bar appears when javascript is turned off. I didn't notice this happening on other pages such as http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/ which works as expected so I'm not sure if this is happening else where or not. Thanks,

Hi Simon,

We've just forced though a new image form SiteEye

This seems to have been  a problem with the connection dropping with SiteEye althoguh we do check we have received a JPG we can't check we have a non-corrupted one (to do that we need a checksum which I don't think SiteEye offer)

thanks

Jamie

* If SiteYye ran the image though a checksum function before uploading the image and then stored that checksum with the image as EXIF data we could then check we have received the whole image successfully. at the other end. As it stands we just have to assume that if we have a file of the smae length with JPG headers then it's OK. If they don't have it in place already they may find it difficult / be reluctant to implement it, but it may be worth asking in passing if they have such a feature, as it means we can re-request any image where the checksum doesn't match.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Md5sum
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simple_file_verification
